entry.title: Bitcoin components.
entry.summary: In this email thread, Alan Grimes expresses his desire to implement his own version of the peer and wallet boxes in a diagram related to Bitcoin's code. He mentions that he finds the existing code unreliable as it is poorly documented and not trustworthy. However, another member of the thread responds with skepticism towards individuals wanting to write their own client from scratch, stating that many people have already attempted this but fail to contribute significantly to the project. They suggest that Bitcoin's code can be segmented into necessary pieces and comments are being added to improve documentation. The member also cautions against new implementations of the code, emphasizing that the current code is much more reliable than anything a new coder would produce, even with extensive comments. Instead, they encourage individuals to help improve existing libraries or contribute to the original client for the betterment of the project.
